text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires describing at least three enforcement mechanisms, such as fines, injunctions, and director liability. The candidate answer explicitly lists and describes seven distinct enforcement mechanisms under the section 'Enforcement Mechanisms That Strengthen Compliance': 1. Mandatory Pay Audits & Corrective Action, 2. Financial Penalties for Non-Compliance (fines mentioned), 3. Public Shaming & \"Name-and-Shame\" Lists, 4. Private Right of Action (allowing lawsuits), 5. Government Contracting & Procurement Leverage, 6. Whistleblower Protections & Anti-Retaliation Laws, and 7. Intersectional Data Requirements. This clearly satisfies the requirement of describing at least three mechanisms.", "criterion_id": "12b6750b-2ee2-4775-ab21-303102470faf"}
